trans-unit.source: Displays editable text information in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
The DataGridViewTextBoxCell class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display a single string of editable text-based information.

The currently selected DataGridViewTextBoxCell hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxEditingControl> control in which the user can edit the cell's value (assuming the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ReadOnly%2A> property of the DataGridViewTextBoxCell is set to `false`).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new DataGridViewTextBoxCell.

To pattern the cells within a column after an existing DataGridViewTextBoxCell, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell.
Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change.
Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell"></xref> class.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.
Override the Clone method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell> and add new properties to the derived class.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell"></xref>.
Removes the cell's editing control from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Gets the type of the formatted value associated with the cell.
The type of the underlying formatted value is always <xref:System.String> because a text box only handles text information
A <xref:System.Type> representing the <xref:System.String> type in all cases.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> and cell style.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's contents.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's error icon, if one is displayed.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's error icon, if one is displayed; otherwise, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell.
The zero-based row index of the cell.
The cell's maximum allowable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
Attaches and initializes the hosted editing control.

The InitializeEditingControl method initializes the hosted editing control as described in the base <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

For every invocation, this method also sets the following visual attributes of the editing control: - The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase.BorderStyle%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle>.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox.Multiline%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox.AcceptsReturn%2A> properties are set to `true`.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox.Text%2A> property is set to the `initialFormattedValue` parameter.
The index of the row being edited.
The initial value to be displayed in the control.
A cell style that is used to determine the appearance of the hosted control.
Determines if edit mode should be started based on the given key.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode>, the control uses this method to determine whether a key other than F2 that is pressed by the user while this cell has focus will cause the cell to enter edit mode.

This method returns `true` if the e parameter indicates an ordinary data-entry key (such as a letter, number, punctuation mark, or the SPACE key) unmodified by ALT or CTRL, excluding SHIFT+SPACE, which is used by the control for selection purposes.
For more information, see [Default Keyboard and Mouse Handling in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that represents the key that was pressed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if edit mode should be started; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text box.
The MaxInputLength property does not affect the length of text entered programmatically through the cell's value or through cell formatting.
It affects only what the user can input and edit.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn.MaxInputLength%2A> property of the owning column also sets the MaxInputLength property of every cell in the column.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
The maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text box; the default value is 32767.
The value is less than 0.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> when the selection cursor moves onto a cell.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnEnter%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The index of the row entered by the mouse.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cell was entered as a result of a mouse click; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> when the mouse leaves a cell.
Resets the instance's click state to ensure that leaving then re-entering the cell requires a double click to start edit mode.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnLeave%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The index of the row the mouse has left.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cell was left as a result of a mouse click; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> when the mouse leaves a cell.
OnMouseClick determines whether the mouse click is part of a double click that starts an edit session.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseClick%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseClick?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
The formatted data of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Sets the location and size of the editing control hosted by a cell in the DataGridView control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to have the control placed as specified by the other arguments; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to allow the control to place itself.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to specify the size; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to allow the control to size itself.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that defines the cell bounds.
The area that will be used to paint the editing control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell being edited.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to add a vertical border to the cell; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to add a horizontal border to the cell; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the hosting cell is in the first visible column; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the hosting cell is in the first visible row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a string that describes the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets or sets the data type of the values in the cell.
A <xref:System.Type> representing the data type of the value in the cell.
